most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
Pasting in VS Code causes delay
Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
CTRL + V (Super + V) Doesn't work for Screenshots

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Launching Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS and Desktop App failing to launch, getting stuck on connecting, or displaying a white screen. This appears to be related to UI state, potential conflicts with system configurations, and issues with Pieces OS hosting applets. Proposed solutions include reinstalling the app, updating to the latest version, checking log files, and contacting support for further assistance.

related_issues.title: White screen on Windows 11
related_issues.text:
White screen on Windows 11
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Installed it yesterday and it was fine until it's a permanently blank screen today when I launch the Pieces Desktop app.

I reinstalled the entire suite multiple times and it's still the same.

![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/33184869/bfba2d65-0393-4ef6-b8f9-dc958201fe5d)

## Conversation Summary on GitHub Issue

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing a white screen issue in the Pieces Desktop Application.
* The issue seems to be related to UI state information.
* Users have tried reinstalling the application and updating to the latest version (3.1.0), but the issue persists.

**Problems Identified:**

* The white screen prevents users from accessing the application.
* The cause of the issue is unknown.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User @mack-at-pieces requested the local folder related to the Desktop App for further investigation.
* Users were advised to try reinstalling the latest version of the app.
* User @mack-at-pieces offered to troubleshoot live with affected users.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved for some users.
* User @JeffreyMJohnson has scheduled a troubleshooting session with @mack-at-pieces.
* User @ubranch expressed dissatisfaction with the Flutter stack used for the application.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation spans over several weeks, with new users reporting the issue.
* User @jiaweing initially reported the issue and provided screenshots.
* User @mack-at-pieces is actively responding to users and trying to resolve the issue.

* The issue caused problems with the app's functionality.

**Problems Identified:**

* The exact nature of the issue is unclear.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user has not responded with the requested logs.
* The issue remains unresolved. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place on November 14, 2024.
* The user did not provide any additional information about the issue.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@Andrea3i) reported issues launching the OS toolbar in various ways.
* Initial investigation pointed to a potential problem with the Visual Studio plugin.
* Further investigation revealed a broader issue with Pieces OS attempting to host applets.
* The Dart language SDK is not returning the actual OS error code, making it difficult to pinpoint the root cause.

**Problems Identified:**

* OS toolbar not launching.
* Pieces OS restarting on its own.
* Visual Studio plugin issue causing UI thread hang (partially resolved).
* Underlying issue with Pieces OS attempting to host applets.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Hotfix for Visual Studio plugin (version 3.0.1) released.
* Pieces OS update (version 10.1.15) released with changes to webview port selection.
* Request for user to schedule a time for further debugging.
* Plan to run a utility to retrieve the OS error code for diagnosis.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User confirmed the issue persists after updates.
* The root cause of the problem is still under investigation.
* Next steps involve scheduling a time for detailed debugging and retrieving the OS error code.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue may be related to various factors, including lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, or permission issues.
* The conversation suggests ongoing communication and collaboration between the user and the Pieces team to resolve the problem.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and VS Code Extension Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various issues with Pieces OS and its VS Code extension, including slow performance, UI glitches, and difficulties launching the OS toolbar.  Troubleshooting steps include updating to the latest version, checking system compatibility, and reviewing log files. The Pieces team is actively working on resolving these issues and improving user experience.

related_issues.title: Pasting in VS Code causes delay
related_issues.text:
Pasting in VS Code causes delay
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Sometimes I notice pasting in VS Code causes a delay of around 2-5 seconds. When I disable Pieces it no longer occurs. Specifically, it is pasting anywhere within the code, not necessarily inside the chat assistant. If it happens frequently, I am forced to turn off pieces, otherwise workflow is significantly disrupted.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Avonbek reported an issue with slowdowns encountered with the 'paste' command in the Pieces VS Code extension.
* The issue occurs intermittently on both VS Code Insiders and the production version.
* Avonbek suspects the slowdowns might be related to the performance of their machine.

**Problems identified:**

* The 'paste' command sometimes causes a delay in the Pieces extension, hindering productivity.
* The cause of the slowdowns is unclear, potentially related to performance limitations.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Caleb suggested removing/rebinding the keybind to the 'paste' command as a temporary workaround.
* Caleb proposed further optimization efforts to address the performance issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Avonbek has not encountered the slowdown since trying the workaround. They will continue to monitor and report if the issue persists.

**Additional notes:**

* Avonbek expressed appreciation for the project and its potential.
* Caleb offered further assistance and collaboration to investigate the issue.

related_issues.title: VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
related_issues.text:
VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.10

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Copilot side bar works fine but I haven't been able to find a setting to wrap lines especially in the responses code blocks.
Is there a setting for Pieces extension to wrap all text Markdown and Code Blocks??

See below, markdown text is wrapped but code block text isn't which for myself isn't ideal?
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eec00284-7ad3-4895-9969-d66488120d76)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User johnkennyuk suggests implementing code unwrapping for single-line scripts in Pieces OS.
* caleb-at-pieces agrees and highlights the usefulness of this feature.

**Problems Identified:**

* Currently, code blocks in single-line scripts are not unwrapped, making them difficult to read and edit.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* caleb-at-pieces proposes adding code unwrapping for single-line scripts.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The feature is added to the project board and expected to be implemented in a future release of Pieces OS.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@Andrea3i) reported issues launching the OS toolbar in various ways.
* Initial investigation pointed to a potential problem with the Visual Studio plugin.
* Further investigation revealed a broader issue with Pieces OS attempting to host applets.
* The Dart language SDK is not returning the actual OS error code, making it difficult to pinpoint the root cause.

**Problems Identified:**

* OS toolbar not launching.
* Pieces OS restarting on its own.
* Visual Studio plugin issue causing UI thread hang (partially resolved).
* Underlying issue with Pieces OS attempting to host applets.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Hotfix for Visual Studio plugin (version 3.0.1) released.
* Pieces OS update (version 10.1.15) released with changes to webview port selection.
* Request for user to schedule a time for further debugging.
* Plan to run a utility to retrieve the OS error code for diagnosis.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User confirmed the issue persists after updates.
* The root cause of the problem is still under investigation.
* Next steps involve scheduling a time for detailed debugging and retrieving the OS error code.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue may be related to various factors, including lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, or permission issues.
* The conversation suggests ongoing communication and collaboration between the user and the Pieces team to resolve the problem.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS crashes or gets stuck
common_issues.description: Users reported Pieces OS crashing or getting stuck when launching or accessing specific features, such as "Discover Integrations" or the Visual Studio extension.  Log analysis hasn't revealed a consistent root cause. Solutions included hotfixes for the Visual Studio plugin and Pieces OS updates to address webview port selection.  Further investigation is ongoing, focusing on debugging and obtaining detailed OS error codes.

related_issues.title: Crash on clicking on "Discover Integrations"
related_issues.text:
Crash on clicking on "Discover Integrations"
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When clicking the menu point "Discover Integrations" the pieces os crashes after a few seconds and needs to be restarted.

Menu: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/7874631/ee50cf5a-c02b-481f-af39-df96bd214437)
System Details: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/7874631/27dabc03-a33e-4b59-b496-86f532c8a56e)

## Summary of GitHub conversation about Pieces OS crashing

**Key Points:**

* @Idrinth reported Piece OS crashes upon clicking the "Discover Integrations" button
* Log files provided by @Idrinth were analyzed by @mack-at-pieces and found clean
* The issue appears to be consistent and reproducible

**Problems:**

* Pieces OS crashes when the user attempts to access integrations
* No obvious cause was found in log files

**Solutions:**

* Currently, no solution has been implemented, but the investigating team (@mack-at-pieces and  @nathan-courtney-pieces) suspects a GTK-related issue

**Current status/outcome:**

* The problem is acknowledged and under investigation.
* Users are advised  to avoid clicking the "Discover Integrations" button until a fix is available.
* The investigating team will update the conversation with further information.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Conflicts on Windows
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces OS and Windows, particularly with Firefox and Visual Studio. Issues include Firefox process hijacking, Pieces OS getting stuck, and VS extension failures. Proposed solutions involve disabling WorkStream Pattern Engine, updating Pieces OS, and debugging OS error codes.

related_issues.title: FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
related_issues.text:
FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Clicking on any link within the Pieces desktop app that required a browser to open up, I would receive the message:
Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window.
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/706ac8c5-b939-4183-af48-ba573901f6ba)

After further review, it does appear that all instances of firefox are spawned under the Pieces OS service:
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/716495d0-b4aa-4bfa-b8d4-d0baf32c8984)

I know that disabling the WorkStream Pattern Engine, this is not an issue. (Assuming I kill off all processes of firefox under that task).


It makes me think that since Pieces OS is hijacking the process, and then firefox is trying to spawn the instance outside of that process, there is a conflict.


My default browser is set to firefox.

I'm running W11.
## Github Issue Summary: Firefox Instances Nested Under Pieces for Developers App

### Key Points:

- Firefox instances spawned within "Pieces for Developers" appear as nested processes.
- Issue occurs regardless of system restarts and only within the Pieces app.
- Problem appears specific to Windows Insider Preview builds.

### Problems Identified:

- Firefox instances launch abnormally under the Pieces app, causing potential performance and compatibility issues.
- Confusion regarding OS version displayed within Pieces app ("Windows 10 Home" despite running Windows 11).


### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

- Investigation needed to determine why the problem occurs on Windows Insider Preview builds.

## Current Status/Outcome:

- No solution implemented yet.
- Issue confirmed as not affecting non-Insider Preview builds.

* OS toolbar not launching.
* Pieces OS restarting on its own.
* Visual Studio plugin issue causing UI thread hang (partially resolved).
* Underlying issue with Pieces OS attempting to host applets.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Hotfix for Visual Studio plugin (version 3.0.1) released.
* Pieces OS update (version 10.1.15) released with changes to webview port selection.
* Request for user to schedule a time for further debugging.
* Plan to run a utility to retrieve the OS error code for diagnosis.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User confirmed the issue persists after updates.
* The root cause of the problem is still under investigation.
* Next steps involve scheduling a time for detailed debugging and retrieving the OS error code.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue may be related to various factors, including lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, or permission issues.
* The conversation suggests ongoing communication and collaboration between the user and the Pieces team to resolve the problem.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with the Pieces Desktop app, including scrolling problems during answer generation, connection errors, and a white screen bug. Proposed solutions involve updating to the latest version, providing logs for analysis, and troubleshooting with support. Some issues remain unresolved.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

2.12.2

### Early Access Program

- [X] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When answering, the curser stays with the question, should move to the answer. Requires clicking the arrow-down symbol to the end and then fine-navigating to the begin of the answer.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Problem:** 
* Difficulty in scrolling up while a response is being generated, making it hard to read the initial content while it's being completed.
* This issue was observed with the Mistral 7B offline model.

**Key points:**

* **bardo84**: Desired functionality for message streaming includes scrolling up/down, jumping to the top/bottom of the answer, and the ability to distinguish similar responses.
* **mack-at-pieces**: Team is working on enhancements for scroll behavior. More suggestions and feedback are welcome.
* **jenshor**: Difficulty in scrolling while content is being generated using a macOS trackpad.

**Solutions:**

* Team implemented improvements for scrolling behavior. 

**Current Status:**

* @jimbobbennett suggests checking the latest version to confirm the issue is resolved. 

**Outcome:**

*  The issue is acknowledged, addressed by the team, and potentially resolved with the latest version update.

related_issues.title: White screen on Windows 11
related_issues.text:
White screen on Windows 11
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Installed it yesterday and it was fine until it's a permanently blank screen today when I launch the Pieces Desktop app.

I reinstalled the entire suite multiple times and it's still the same.

![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/33184869/bfba2d65-0393-4ef6-b8f9-dc958201fe5d)

## Conversation Summary on GitHub Issue

**Key Points Raised:**

* Users are experiencing a white screen issue in the Pieces Desktop Application.
* The issue seems to be related to UI state information.
* Users have tried reinstalling the application and updating to the latest version (3.1.0), but the issue persists.

**Problems Identified:**

* The white screen prevents users from accessing the application.
* The cause of the issue is unknown.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* User @mack-at-pieces requested the local folder related to the Desktop App for further investigation.
* Users were advised to try reinstalling the latest version of the app.
* User @mack-at-pieces offered to troubleshoot live with affected users.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved for some users.
* User @JeffreyMJohnson has scheduled a troubleshooting session with @mack-at-pieces.
* User @ubranch expressed dissatisfaction with the Flutter stack used for the application.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation spans over several weeks, with new users reporting the issue.
* User @jiaweing initially reported the issue and provided screenshots.
* User @mack-at-pieces is actively responding to users and trying to resolve the issue.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces OS launch issues:** The most frequent and active tickets indicate problems with Pieces OS and Desktop App launching. Focus on identifying the root cause and providing a solution to improve user experience.

**Investigate and address VS Code extension issues:** Issues related to the VS Code extension, such as slow performance and UI glitches, are also prevalent. Allocate resources to investigate and resolve these issues to ensure seamless integration.

**Improve communication on known issues:**  For issues like the Firefox conflict and the white screen bug, ensure clear communication about workarounds or temporary solutions while a permanent fix is being developed.
**Gather more detailed logs and system information:**  Encourage users to provide detailed logs and system configurations when reporting issues to help with faster diagnosis and resolution.

**Consider a dedicated support channel for EAP users:** Given the number of EAP-related tickets, explore creating a dedicated support channel or forum to address their specific needs and feedback more effectively.
